meanings.definition: To coat or cover with plaster or mortar.
meanings.sent1: The builders pargetted the walls to make them smooth.
meanings.sent2: She pargetted the ceiling to hide the imperfections.
meanings.sent3: The cat pargetted itself with dust while playing in the attic.
meanings.sent4: The artist pargetted the canvas with vibrant colors, creating a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The gardener pargetted the pots with a special sealant to protect them from the rain.

meanings.definition: Covered or decorated with plaster or mortar.
meanings.sent1: The pargetted walls in the old house gave it a rustic charm.
meanings.sent2: The pargetted fireplace looked elegant in the living room.
meanings.sent3: The pargetted statue in the garden seemed to come to life in the moonlight.
meanings.sent4: The pargetted columns of the building stood strong against the test of time.
meanings.sent5: The pargetted pathway through the garden was a delight to walk on.
